title: How does the LP system work? I'm confused.
body:
So I recently played a ranked game. I'm silver 5, and I was placed in a game with 2 bronze 2 players and 2 bronze 3 players. I was last pick so got forced to support. My ADC had 42 CS at 20 minutes. I checked op.gg and found that the other team had as S5 and 4 B2 players. Naturally we had nearly lost the game at 20 minutes so we surrendered. 

Then in the endgame screen I find out that I've lost 27 LP for that game. Seems a bit unfair that I get punished the hardest when I am in the minority. As I said I was forced to play support, so how can I have an impact on the game? And why am I getting matched with people 4 ranks below me?

this is a bit unfair. when you play duo lane you have to rely too much on the other person. doesnt matter which role you are. if the adc is horrible and you're support then there's nothing you can do. you can't "carry" the adc that is terrible.

the support is the pillars of a team, unless the adc is fed or actually does damage, the sup would be more valuable. A sup doesn't need to be fed to go beast mode, but adc usually does. If the sup if good enough they are actually the ones that carry the team, they set up fights and get it all prepped for the rest of the team to clear and win.

i am not talking about the rest of the match. im talking about laning phase specifically in bot lane. a support can not single handed win it assuming the opponents are playing well enough. im talking about incredibly bad adcs. can't last hit even if it's free + sit still and take all kinds of harass and cc + don't follow anything up and don't seem to realise that they are supposed to auto attack in fights, not just use one ability and turn tail + build completely wrong. no matter what you do these players usually end up feeding or become 100% useless. and guess what happens? the rest of the team says things like "this bot" or 'report our bot please". it doesn't matter how good you support in lane, the adc still needs to do something in order to get fed and not feed themselves.

in regards to the rest of the match and other lanes, the same still applies. the other carries need to actually do something. they have to follow up and then also use any advantage you did get them. a support relies on their teammates as much as anyone else, if not more.

i would say my best role is support and i used to main support. hundreds of games in a row. i've since quit that and play mostly mid and jungle. all too often i had team mates that just were too bad for me to have any real impact on the game regardless of how good i might have played. now i find i can have a greater impact on the game playing "carry' roles even if i have bad team mates. i can now win games through getting my self fed and snowballing. i could not do that playing a traditional support.

Bot lane is usually won by the support. And in bronze and silver nearly everyone playing support is only there because they were last pick and have no idea what they're doing. If you spend even a little time actually getting decent at support instead of trying to avoid it like the plague, you  can get kills and snowball in lane with little to no input from your adc.

it's apparently matching you with people of similar MMR, yet it also flags you as someone that should be winning because you're silver 5. the problem is that logic would suggest that you have a 50% chance to lose as your win/loss should end up to be roughly 50% in the long term (assuming you're playing against similarly "skilled" players). and so then it punishes you for losing when there's in fact a good chance to lose, making it seem unfair. the reason it is doing this is because the system is trying really hard to demote you to the tier and rank that reflects your MMR. no matter how hard you try, you will get demoted eventually UNLESS you start winning the vast majority of your games and proving to the system that you do belong in silver 5.

You have a hidden rating called mmr which is a much more accurate representation of your skill level than your division/LP. It is this rating that determines the people you are matched with and your LP gains and losses. You cannot drop from silver to bronze unless your mmr falls to that of a bronze 5 player i believe (Which is so that people don't lose their season rewards too easily). Many silver 5 players are essentially bronze level players that are still in silver because the system is such that they cannot actually fall to bronze. This is likely the situation you are in which is why you are matched with mainly bronze players. You also need to raise your mmr back to silver 5ish level before you will start seeing any meaningful LP gains.
it means your mmr is trash.
